channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Trump’s ‘Reverse Nixon’ Foreign Policy Can Avoid Nixon’s Costly Mistakes
item.description: President Trump’s 'reverse Nixon' approach carries profound risks, as the current geopolitical realities starkly contrast those of the 1970s.

item.title: Appeals court allows Trump to fire watchdog who delayed other terminations
item.description: A federal appeals court gave President Trump at least a short-term victory Wednesday in allowing him to oust a government watchdog who has emerged as ...

item.title: The Supreme Court Should Not Encourage a One-Judge Constitutional Crisis
item.description: Amir Ali shouldn’t be allowed to direct U.S. foreign policy.

item.title: Biden-nominated federal judge extends hold on Trump NIH research funding cuts
item.description: Biden-nominated federal Judge blocks the National Institutes of Health from applying a standard indirect cost rate of 15% across the board for grants.

item.title: Musk admits mistakes, shares DOGE progress report with House Republicans
item.description: Billionaire and efficiency czar Elon Musk capped off a day on Capitol Hill with a meeting with House Republicans where he admitted to making mistakes ...

item.title: Trump could sell Nancy Pelosi Federal Building 'at fair market value' under new GOP bill
item.description: A House GOP bill would allow President Donald Trump to move forward with selling the Nancy Pelosi Federal Building.

item.title: Trump moves House GOP holdouts closer to supporting government funding extension
item.description: House Republican holdouts appear closer to supporting a plan to avert a partial government shutdown after a meeting with President Trump.

item.title: Trump's speech used as evidence against him in court

item.title: How Trump justifies his tariffs -- from budget balancing to protecting 'the soul' of America
item.description: To President Donald Trump, "tariff" is more than "the most beautiful word in the dictionary," something he says often.

item.title: Speaker Johnson slams Dem Rep. Green's 'egregious behavior' during Trump's address

item.title: If The Supreme Court Is Going To Ignore The Constitution, Trump Should Ignore The Supreme Court
item.description: Lower courts don’t have authority to usurp the executive branch through restraining orders and injunctions, no matter what the SCOTUS says.

item.title: GOP lawmaker credits Trump's business prowess for major investment in state: 'Knows how to make deals'

item.title: Will Republicans Cut Corporate Welfare?
item.description: The GOP should curb business subsidies, corporate-tax loopholes, and the protection of favored industries.

item.title: A French Coup for the Art Institute of Chicago
item.description: The Horvitz collection of Old Master French drawings and paintings, the best in America, heads to Chicago as a gift.

item.title: Politico Stealth Edits Error-Filled Hit Piece On GOP Spending Bill
item.description: When I asked Politico about omissions to a recent Medicaid article, it didn’t update the story — it rewrote it.

item.title: Trump Mistakes Weakness for Strength
item.description: The president’s repeated claims of victimization only make him smaller.

item.title: The Dream Palace of Gaza
item.description: A delusional Arab proposal for Gaza makes Trump’s plan for rebuilding the Strip from the ground up look pragmatic by comparison.
